headline: Sweetest Southern Sweet Potato Pie
description: Sweet potatoes are whipped until light and fluffy in this sweet treat. Serve it warm or cold with a dollop of whipped cream.

video.description: Looking for a simple sweet potato pie?
video.name: Sweetest Southern Sweet Potato Pie

name: Sweetest Southern Sweet Potato Pie
recipeIngredient: 1 (9 inch) unbaked deep dish pie crust

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place sweet potatoes in an aluminum foil-lined baking dish.
Bake in preheated oven until potatoes are easily pierced with a fork and skin loosens, 30 to 45 minutes. Allow potatoes to cool.

Peel potatoes and mash with a potato masher in a large bowl. Beat sugar, evaporated milk, butter, corn syrup, eggs, flour, vanilla extract, apple pie spice, and salt into mashed sweet potatoes with an electric mixer until fluffy, about 5 minutes. Pour sweet potato batter into pie crust. Excess batter can be reserved for another use.
Bake in preheated oven until pie is set and crust is browned, 45 to 50 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Delicious moist sweet potato pie. Family loved it.
It was amazing! We had enough for 2 pies and I froze one but the other didn't last very long. It was creamy and just perfect.
Awesome Pie - Used honey instead of corn syrup
I love this recipe and so does my family. I always find that a tablespoon of nutmeg and cinnamon takes it to another level.

This is by far the best sweet potato pie recipe ever. I received raving reviews from the toughest critics - my family. ?? I kept it simple and excluded the apple spice and corn syrup - wasn’t necessary...absolutely delicious without it!!!
Thanks for sharing!!
Looks good!
Delicious. I used two cups of brown sugar instead of the white sugar and dark corn syrup.
Easy to make.

Loved this pie! I used several small sweet potatoes and didn't double any of the ingredients but had plenty for TWO pies. Instead of corn syrup, I melted a heaping cup of dark brown sugar in 4 TB water and used that which worked perfectly. Also didn't have apple pie spice or nutmeg which I think would have made it even better. I used cinnamon, cardamon, and allspice. Cut back on the white sugar and was generous with the vanilla. I'll definitely be making these pies again soon!
Kenny said it was as good as his Grandmother's!
I made this recipe, and received rave reviews! Even my Aunt (who is known for her sweet potato pies) said that my pie was better hers! Will DEFINITELY be adding this recipe to my collection..??????
I made this and I loved it
Yes! It tastes just like my Mom's sweet potato pie

If I could give this recipe more stars, I would! Hands down, the best sweet potato pie recipe I’ve tried. This will be my “go-to” recipe from now on. I followed the recipe to a “t” and even bought the apple pie spice as suggested. The taste of sweet potatoes shines through and is accented by the light spices. Oh my ..... this is GOOD!
Did not have sweet potatoes so I used canned yams. I also didn't have evaporated milk so I left out the sugar and use sweetened condensed milk. Came out great!

Delicious pie!!! This one is a keeper! My fiancée wanted me to make her a sweet potato pie and it scared me because I've never even tasted it much less made it. Bake time is wrong, and at no point does anything ever get fluffy...but it comes out in the end and that's what we care about! The lady says this one is a keeper. The lady has spoken!

I made this pie for Thanksgiving on Wednesday. Had to make another Thanksgiving morning. One of the best sweet potatoe pies I have ever had. I did not have dark syrup so I used clear syrup it turned out great. This will be my go to sweet potatoe pie recipe.

Awsome recipe I have never made a sweet potato pie but this recipe is amazing its simple and delicious I subbed the apple pie spice for the pumpkin pie spice I also made mine own crust thats my preference. The pie is definitely sweet so next time ill cut back on the sugar and corn syrup to bring the sweet potatoes stand out more if anyone has some other subs for the recipe I'd love to hear it.
I baked it at 425 for 15 minutes then 325 for 40 minutes. My go-to sweet potato recipe.
Made it for thanksgiving everyone loved it got a lot of request to make for Christmas thanks its a hit
Made it for thanksgiving everyone loved it got a lot of request to make for Christmas thanks its a hit
Omg! Soooo good.
Amazing!!! Followed recipe to a T and it came out perfect. Everyone said it was the best they have ever had.

This is THE PIE right here! I chose this recipe because it was simple enough for my first try at a sweet potato pie, yet slightly different than other recipes. Oh my goodness y'all, it was so good. I honestly don't know if you could get a better flavor. The apple pie spice sets it off! My husband is very partial to his mothers pie and he's funny about eating anyone else's. He absolutely loved it! The only thing I would recommend is using very large potatoes if your only going to use 2 like it calls for.. I bought regular sized ones and it was to loose so I had to add 2 more. The consistency was perfect after that. Also, I had to cook it a little longer than 45 min. but it may just be my oven. It made enough for 2 deep dish pies. I will use this recipe from now on!
Best Recipe I have ever used ... I recommend this recipe to everyone

My family LOVED this recipe. This was my first attempt at making sweet potato pie and it was a huge success! The only thing I changed was I added a half of a teasppon more vanilla and a dash more of cinnamon
Hands down, the best one I've ever made.
First time making and trying sweet potato pie, absolutely loved it. Keeping this one for sure tks a lot.
One of the best Sweet Potato Pie I every had. My husband made two for Thanksgiving 2014 and two the day after.
Tried this recipe for Thanksgiving 2013 and everyone loved it. It does take longer than 50 minutes to set but other than that its a great recipes. I recommend it to everyone.

This recipe is quick and VERY easy. My first time making a sweet potato pie and it was delicious. I didn't have corn syrup but followed the recipe otherwise. For those wanting spice, I added more vanilla and a tsp of cinnamon and found it enhanced the pie nicely.
This was a great recipe, in my opinion it was a little too sweet, but still very good. I also chose to use pumpkin pie spice compared to apple pie spice.
What a great recipe-it set up well, and my husband loved it!
Great recipe! I made 3 pies on Thanksgiving and Im making one today! They were soo sweet and goooood! My kids, and husband loved it. This taste just like my dads recipe....from Virginia! :)

I'm the submitter of the recipe. I actually submitted this 6 years ago, and I've made some changes in how I make this now. I usually use cane syrup instead of corn syrup, and depending on how sweet my potatoes are, I cut back a bit on the sugar. The pie is not heavy on a spice flavor due to my preference (I like the sweet poatoes to take center stage), but you can certainly up the spice amount if you prefer a spicier flavor. You can also use pumpkin pie spice; I just like the apple pie spice better. I don't recommend using canned sweet potatoes as the fresh gives a much better flavor, but you can certainly use those in a pinch. As the notes states, this is a very sweet pie, and it's definitely not low calorie. Great for a thanksiving or Christmas table, because it's definitely an indulgence.
